summary: An FBI crisis intake report from July 8, 2019, documenting a call from an informant (name redacted) who provided information about Jeffrey Epstein. The informant claimed to have evidence of Epstein committing massive securities fraud in the 1980s-1990s and suggested his defense funds are tainted, referencing a civil case that could help the FBI seize Epstein's assets.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI intake report; the informant alleges he committed massive securities fraud in the 1980s-1990s and that his defense funds are tainted.

events.title: Alleged securities fraud by Epstein
events.description: The informant claims Jeffrey Epstein committed a massive securities fraud during the 1980s and 1990s.

events.title: FBI crisis intake call
events.description: An informant called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to provide additional information regarding Jeffrey Epstein, alleging securities fraud and tainted defense funds.

keyFacts: An informant contacted the FBI on July 8, 2019, alleging Jeffrey Epstein committed massive securities fraud in the 1980s-1990s.
The informant claimed Epstein's money used for his legal defense is 'tainted' from the alleged fraud.
The informant referenced a civil case that could provide the FBI a 'connection' to seize Epstein's assets.
The document is an FBI crisis intake report, indicating the information was formally logged for potential investigation.
